The article highlights the ongoing discussion surrounding the system's relatively short operational lifespan.

title: Apache Fire Control: Enhancing Precision and Survivability with TADS/PNVS Modernization
summary: This article highlights Lockheed Martin's ongoing advancements to the Target Acquisition Designation Sensor/Pilot Night Vision Sensor (TADS/PNVS) system, including the Generation 3 Day Sensor Assembly (Gen 3 DSA) and Generation 2 Turret (G2T). These modernizations aim to enhance performance, mitigate obsolescence, and improve reliability and maintainability for AH-64D/E Apache helicopter pilots globally.

title: Lockheed Martin Secures Contract for Generation 4 TADS/PNVS Systems to Support Polish Ministry of Defence's Acquisition of AH-64E Apache Attack Helicopters
summary: Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control has secured a contract from the U.S. government for the production of Generation 4 Target Acquisition Designation Sight/Pilot Night Vision Sensor (TADS/PNVS) systems for Poland's AH-64E Apache attack helicopters. This contract marks the first time the Common Sensor Electronic Unit (CSEU) and Generation 2 Turret (G2T) will be included as baseline components for Apache sensors, enhancing long-range target acquisition, precision engagement, and pilot vision capabilities. Additionally, Lockheed Martin will collaborate with Poland to establish a TADS/PNVS Special Repair Activity (SRA) facility to support local maintenance and repair.

title: Lockheed Martin Upgrades Sensor Systems On Egypt's Apache Fleet Under New Contract
summary: Lockheed Martin received a $102 million contract to upgrade 25 of Egypt's AH-64D Apaches to the E-model version, which includes their Gen III Target Acquisition Designation Sight/Pilot Night Vision Sensor (Gen III TADS/PNVS) and the Gen III Day Sensor Assembly (Gen III DSA). This modernization provides pilots with long-range precision engagement and pilotage capabilities for day, night, and adverse weather missions, and increases designation and ranging capabilities.

title: Lockheed Martin and Insta sign cooperation agreement to expand defence innovation and transatlantic industrial ties
summary: Lockheed Martin and Finnish company Insta have signed a Memorandum of Understanding to enhance defense innovation and industrial resilience. The agreement focuses on joint development and exploration of opportunities in mission-critical areas such as command and control, sensor integration, and sustainment, which are key components of C4ISR.

title: Lockheed Martin Awarded C2BMC-Next Contract to Enhance Global Interoperability
summary: Lockheed Martin has been awarded the C2BMC-Next contract, continuing its role as the lead for the C2BMC National Team. This contract focuses on improving global interoperability and integrating advanced 21st Century Security technology into the nation's battle management system, which is a critical C4ISR function.

title: Deep Learning Model Speeds Up, Automates Satellite Image Analysis
summary: This article details how Lockheed Martin's Global Automated Target Recognition (GATR) system uses open-source deep learning to identify and classify objects in satellite imagery, saving analysts significant time. GATR operates in the cloud, leveraging Maxar's Geospatial Big Data platform and its extensive imagery library for efficient algorithm training and high accuracy.

title: Lockheed Martin automates satellite image analysis
summary: This article reports on Lockheed Martin's development of GATR, an AI-powered satellite imagery recognition system. It explains how GATR uses deep learning and Maxar's GBDX platform to quickly identify and classify objects, significantly reducing the manual effort in image analysis. The system boasts over 90% accuracy and can scan vast areas rapidly.

title: Lockheed Martin develops AI model for satellite imagery analysis
summary: This piece highlights Lockheed Martin's Global Automated Target Recognition (GATR) as a cloud-based AI model that streamlines satellite imagery analysis. It leverages Maxar's platform to access a massive imagery library, enabling rapid identification and classification of various objects with high accuracy, thus freeing analysts for more complex tasks. A public demo at GEOINT 2019 showcased its ability to search vast areas efficiently.

title: HercFusion: AI Tech Revolutionizing C-130 Maintenance and Performance - YouTube
summary: This YouTube video from Lockheed Martin highlights HercFusion as an AI technology that is transforming C-130 maintenance and performance. It explains that HercFusion, developed with SAS, is a tool suite that allows maintenance and flight operations teams to monitor the health of an aircraft down to the part level. By predicting part replacements, it significantly increases fleet readiness and reduces aircraft downtime, ensuring the C-130J is consistently prepared for missions.

title: RTX Partners With Shield AI To Bolster Uncrewed Capabilities
summary: RTX has formed a new partnership with Shield AI to integrate Shield AI's Hivemind autonomy software into select RTX defense products, including loitering munitions and sensors. This collaboration aims to deliver advanced, autonomous capabilities to U.S. and allied defense forces, enabling the deployment of the first operational weapon powered by Networked Collaborative Autonomy.

title: RTX, Shield AI picked to give Collaborative Combat Aircraft autonomous capabilities
summary: The U.S. Air Force has selected defense giant RTX and Shield AI to provide autonomy capabilities for its first round of Collaborative Combat Aircraft (CCA), which are drone wingmen. RTX will supply the autonomy software for General Atomics' YFQ-42A, contributing to intelligent, collaborative operations for the warfighter.

title: Lockheed Martin Uses AI to Strengthen PAC-3 Defense System
summary: Lockheed Martin is enhancing its PAC-3 Missile Segment Enhancement (MSE) system through the integration of artificial intelligence and machine learning. This initiative aims to improve the system's speed, intelligence, and effectiveness against modern threats, enabling quicker detection, tracking, and response to targets and real-time adaptation to changing threat patterns.
product: Lockheed Martin PAC-3 Defense System (AI enhanced)

title: Boeing, RAAF Achieve CCA Missile Fire from MQ-28 Ghost Bat
summary: In a historic achievement on December 9, 2025, Boeing and the Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF) successfully demonstrated a force integrated air-to-air autonomous weapon engagement with an MQ-28 Ghost Bat. The MQ-28 teamed with an E-7A Wedgetail and an F/A-18F Super Hornet to destroy a fighter-class target drone using an AIM-120 AMRAAM missile. This event marks the first time an autonomous aircraft has completed such an air-to-air weapon engagement.

title: Boeing Australia Details New Features for Ghost Bat
summary: Boeing Australia's MQ-28 Ghost Bat stealth drone is receiving a Block 3 upgrade, which includes internal weapons bays, a lengthened wingspan for improved aerodynamic efficiency, and increased operational autonomy. These enhancements aim to bring the aircraft closer to its intended mission capabilities, with an expected entry into service in 2028. A recent test demonstrated the drone's ability to launch an air-to-air missile at a target drone with minimal commands while controlled by a Boeing E-7 aircraft.

title: Boeing wins new deal for Australian Ghost Bats
summary: The Australian Government has awarded Boeing Defence Australia an AUD$754 million contract to deliver, develop, and support a third tranche of MQ-28 Ghost Bats over the next three years. This contract falls under the AIR6015 Autonomous Collaborative Platforms – Air Program and will provide additional Block 2 and Block 3 aircraft to support the development of an operational capability by 2028. The goal is to supplement the Royal Australian Air Force's existing crewed fleet with integrated Collaborative Combat Aircraft.

title: Advanced-Surface Movement Guidance and Control System - ReAnIn
summary: The Advanced-Surface Movement Guidance and Control System (A-SMGCS) Market is experiencing steady growth due to increased focus on safe and efficient aircraft movement at airports. This system integrates surveillance, guidance, and control to enhance situational awareness and operational coordination. Over 60% of modernized airports have adopted A-SMGCS technologies to manage complex ground traffic patterns effectively.
product: Advanced Surface Movement Guidance and Control (A-SMGCS)

title: Advanced-Surface Movement Guidance & Control System (a-SMGCS) Market Outlook 2026-2030 - GlobeNewswire
summary: The A-SMGCS market is projected to grow from $5.58 billion in 2025 to $5.93 billion in 2026, driven by increased deployment of surveillance radars, integration of vehicle tracking systems, and airport modernization. This growth is expected to continue, reaching $7.34 billion by 2030, spurred by investments in advanced surveillance and multilateration technologies, and automation adoption for optimizing ground traffic flow.
product: Advanced Surface Movement Guidance and Control (A-SMGCS)

title: Analysis and Application of Advanced Surface Movement Guidance and Control System (A-Smgcs) Technology - Oreate AI Blog
summary: The International Civil Aviation Organization's (ICAO) DOC 9830 document forms the core regulatory framework for A-SMGCS, detailing system architecture, functional modules, and performance indicators. A-SMGCS is categorized into five technical levels, evolving from basic monitoring to autonomous operation, with higher levels offering advanced features like real-time conflict detection and automated guidance.
product: Advanced Surface Movement Guidance and Control (A-SMGCS)

title: Top 10 Remote Towers Companies Dominating the Market in 2024
summary: Lockheed Martin is identified as a leading provider in the remote tower solutions market, offering its 'SkyGuardian' system. This solution incorporates advanced sensor technology, AI-powered automation, and cyber resilience, with recent integrations of machine learning algorithms to enhance air traffic flow prediction and management.

title: The Power of Digital Twins
summary: Lockheed Martin engineers are leveraging digital twin technology to transform the design, development, and operation of complex systems for their customers. This involves creating virtual models to simulate behavior, monitor operations, and ultimately enhance performance, safety, and accelerate product development.

title: Assessing F-35 latest purchase and future order of battle by variants and blocks
summary: This article describes the use of an 'INSIGHT terminal' or 'INSIGHT system' by Lockheed Martin to assess the US Air Force F-35 fleet's order of battle for the year 2029. The system leverages DoD announcements and procurement plans to provide detailed analysis of aircraft configurations and quantities. It highlights Lockheed Martin's use of this internal analytical tool in managing and understanding their F-35 program.
source: Unspecified (context suggests a defense or aerospace publication)

title: Air Force Research Laboratory awards BAE Systems $48 million to advance military intelligence analysis capabilities.
summary: BAE Systems secured a $48 million contract from the Air Force Research Laboratory to further develop its 'Insight system'. This system is a next-generation Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) exploitation and resource management tool. It utilizes machine learning, autonomy, and predictive analytics to enhance military intelligence analysis.
source: IMARC Group / SNS Insider / BAE Systems (Press Release)

title: AN/ASQ-239 F-35 EW countermeasure system | Next Generation Electronic Warfare: Aircraft Protection
summary: This article, from BAE Systems, discusses the AN/ASQ-239 electronic warfare system for the Lockheed Martin F-35 aircraft. It mentions that the 'Insight system' (developed by BAE Systems) leverages machine learning and autonomy to help intelligence analysts process vast amounts of data for actionable intelligence related to the F-35. This showcases how the Insight system is applied to enhance the capabilities and analysis surrounding Lockheed Martin's F-35.

title: Lockheed Martin Hydra Fusion Tools
summary: This article introduces Hydra Fusion Tools as Lockheed Martin's solution for managing big data generated by unmanned systems. It explains that the tool fuses various data, such as maps, images, video, and intelligence, into a common, immersive 3D operational picture. Key features include real-time structure from motion and applications in site mapping, agriculture, and infrastructure inspection.

title: Hydra Fusion Tools™ - Lockheed Martin
summary: This capabilities guide details Hydra Fusion Tools™ as a real-time Geospatial Information System (GIS) designed to transform large quantities of disparate data from unmanned aircraft systems into actionable intelligence. It highlights the system's ability to simultaneously localize and map (SLAM) incoming video or still image feeds to create immediate and immersive 3D reconstructions. The tool is versatile, supporting various mobile hardware and cameras, and operates locally without needing an internet connection.

title: HYDRA FUSION TOOLS™ - Lockheed Martin
summary: This Lockheed Martin document describes Hydra Fusion Tools™ as a real-time Geospatial Information System that addresses the challenges of big data by fusing diverse information into a scalable 3D world presentation. A standout feature is its Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM) capability, which stitches together image feeds from aircraft to create geo-registered 3D reconstructions. It lists applications such as real-time structure from motion, construction progress monitoring, surveying, and infrastructure inspection.

title: Border Security Technologies Market Size, Share & Growth Report 2033
summary: Lockheed Martin recently showcased an artificial intelligence-enhanced surveillance platform, previewing its 2025 model. This platform features real-time threat detection, advanced radar integration, and autonomous monitoring capabilities designed for complex border environments.

title: Coast Defence Radar Market Outlook 2026-2034
summary: Lockheed Martin is a dominant player in the coast defense radar market, offering innovative radar solutions for coastal monitoring. The company is heavily investing in multi-function radar systems that integrate surveillance, tracking, and threat assessment capabilities. These advanced systems are crucial for modern coastal surveillance operations and contribute to the market's expansion due to heightened demand for advanced surveillance technologies.

title: Airborne Radar Market Size, Share | Industry Report [2032]
summary: Lockheed Martin made significant strides in airborne radar technology, with the January 2024 launch of the Legion Pod featuring IRST21 radar for F-15s, enhancing long-range detection capabilities. Additionally, its SPEAR EW-Radar Pod entered production, selected for the U.S. Army's FTUAS program. The company also introduced Skynode, a modular SDR for F-35s, enabling in-flight waveform updates via 5G links.

title: DCS 2018: Lockheed Martin develops dual-band IR camera core
summary: Lockheed Martin debuted its new µLAD dual-band IR camera core at SPIE's Defense + Commercial Sensing in 2018, featuring high-definition short-wave (SW) and mid-wave (MW) IR imagery at 1280x1024 pixels. This compact and portable camera core is designed for military applications such as pilotage, threat warning, targeting, and can be integrated into UAVs and other platforms. It utilizes nBn detector technology and offers a high frame rate of 360Hz for capabilities like bullet tracking.
